trans-unit.source: Allows filtered input of various types of informational, context-related links.

seg-source.mrk: Allows filtered input of various types of informational, context-related links.

target.mrk: Позволяет вводить различные контент-зависимые ссылки.

trans-unit.source: Lets users log in using a Drupal ID and can notify a central server about your site.

seg-source.mrk: Lets users log in using a Drupal ID and can notify a central server about your site.

target.mrk: Позволяет участникам использовать Drupal ID и добавляет возможность объявления на центральном сервере о вашем сайте.

trans-unit.source: Indents and wraps HTML. Also gives debugging information about spec-conformance.

seg-source.mrk: Indents and wraps HTML.
Also gives debugging information about spec-conformance.

target.mrk: Опознает и перемещает HTML.
Также предоставляет информацию для отладки о spec-conformance.

trans-unit.source: Admins may create many image nodes at once by uploading all images to a folder on the server. This upload happens outside of Drupal, usually using an FTP client.

seg-source.mrk: Admins may create many image nodes at once by uploading all images to a folder on the server.
This upload happens outside of Drupal, usually using an FTP client.

target.mrk: Администраторы могут создавать много узлов изображений одновременно посредством закачивания всех изображений в папку сервера.
Закачивание проводится не Drupal'ом, а внешними средствами, обычно FTP-клиентом.

trans-unit.source: Allow users to upload images and to display them in shared and personal image galleries.

seg-source.mrk: Allow users to upload images and to display them in shared and personal image galleries.

target.mrk: Позволяет пользователям закачивать изображения и использовать их в общих и персональных галереях.

trans-unit.source: Allows users to import external HTML pages quickly and with a minium of editing required.

seg-source.mrk: Allows users to import external HTML pages quickly and with a minium of editing required.

target.mrk: Позволяет пользователям импортировать внешние HTML страницы быстро и с требованием минимального редактирования.

trans-unit.source: Enables the translation of the user interface to languages other than English.

seg-source.mrk: Enables the translation of the user interface to languages other than English.

target.mrk: Разрешает перевод пользовательского интерфейса на языки отличные от английского.

trans-unit.source: Enables your site to capture votes on different topics in the form of multiple choice questions.

seg-source.mrk: Enables your site to capture votes on different topics in the form of multiple choice questions.

target.mrk: Позволяет вашему сайту использовать опросы, по различным темам, с возможностью выбора одновременно нескольких ответов на вопросы.

trans-unit.source: The summary module creates a home page with a number of options for text, image, and link display.

seg-source.mrk: The summary module creates a home page with a number of options for text, image, and link display.

target.mrk: Summary модуль создает страницу с множеством опций для показа текста, изображений и ссылок.

trans-unit.source: Configuration system that lets administrators modify the workings of the site.

seg-source.mrk: Configuration system that lets administrators modify the workings of the site.

target.mrk: Система настроек, которая позволяет администраторам управлять работой сайта.

trans-unit.source: Modules are plugins for Drupal that extend its core functionality. Here you can select which modules are enabled. Click on the name of the module in the navigation menu for their individual configuration pages. Once a module is enabled, new permissions might be made available. Modules can automatically be temporarily disabled to reduce server load when your site becomes extremely busy by checking throttle. The auto-throttle functionality must be enabled on the throttle configuration page after having enabled the throttle module.

seg-source.mrk: Modules are plugins for Drupal that extend its core functionality.
Here you can select which modules are enabled.
Click on the name of the module in the navigation menu for their individual configuration pages.
Once a module is enabled, new permissions might be made available.
Modules can automatically be temporarily disabled to reduce server load when your site becomes extremely busy by checking throttle.
The auto-throttle functionality must be enabled on the throttle configuration page after having enabled the throttle module.

target.mrk: Модули - это добавления для Drupal'a, которые расширяют функциональность ядра.
Здесь вы можете выбрать те модули, которые хотите сделать активными.

После этого необходимо пройти на страницу прав доступа и разрешить использовать модуль для тех или иных категорий пользователей (администратор имеет высший доступ, то есть, все модули для него разрешены).
Модули могут быть автоматически отключены, если сервер не будет справляться с нагрузкой.
Настроить автоматическое отключение в зависимости от нагрузки на сервер можно на странице настройки регулятора, для этого также необходимо сделать модуль ркгулятора активным.

seg-source.mrk: upload

target.mrk: upload

seg-source.mrk: user

target.mrk: user

trans-unit.source: The watchdog module monitors your web site, capturing system events in a log to be reviewed by an authorized individual at a later time. The watchdog log is simply a list of recorded events containing usage data, performance data, errors, warnings and operational information. It is vital to check the watchdog report on a regular basis as it is often the only way to tell what is going on.

seg-source.mrk: The watchdog module monitors your web site, capturing system events in a log to be reviewed by an authorized individual at a later time.
The watchdog log is simply a list of recorded events containing usage data, performance data, errors, warnings and operational information.
It is vital to check the watchdog report on a regular basis as it is often the only way to tell what is going on.

target.mrk: The watchdog module monitors your web site, capturing system events in a log to be reviewed by an authorized individual at a later time.
The watchdog log is simply a list of recorded events containing usage data, performance data, errors, warnings and operational information.
It is vital to check the watchdog report on a regular basis as it is often the only way to tell what is going on.

seg-source.mrk: watchdog

target.mrk: watchdog

trans-unit.source:
This guide explains what the various modules in Drupal do and how to configure them.

It is not a substitute for the Drupal handbook available online and should be used in conjunction with it. The online reference handbook might be more up-to-date and has helpful user-contributed comments. It is your definitive reference point for all Drupal documentation.

Help topics

Help is available on the following items:

%help_pages

Glossary of Drupal Terminology

Block
A small box containing information or content placed in the left-hand or right-hand sidebar of a web page.
Comment
A note attached to a node. Usually intended to clarify, explain, criticize, or express an opinion on the original material.
Moderation
The activity of making sure a post to a Drupal site fits in with what is expected for that Drupal site.
Approved
A moderated post which has been accepted by the moderators for publication. (See published).
Waiting
A moderated post which is still being voted on to be accepted for publication. (See published.)
Moderators
The group of Drupal users that reviews posts before they are published. These users have the "access submission queue" permission. (See Published).
Node
The basic data unit in Drupal. Everything is a node or an extention of a node.
Public
See published.
Published
A node that is viewable by everyone. (See unpublished.)
Role
A classification users are placed into for the purpose of setting users' permissions.
Taxonomy
A division of a collection of things into ordered, classified groups. (See taxonomy help.)
Unpublished
A node that is only viewable by administrators and moderators.
User
A person who has an account at your Drupal site, and is logged in with that account.
Visitor
A person who does not have an account at your Drupal site or a person who has an account at your Drupal site but is not logged in with that account. Also termed "anonymous user".

seg-source.mrk:
\n

This guide explains what the various modules in Drupal do and how to configure them.

\n

It is not a substitute for the Drupal handbook available online and should be used in conjunction with it.
The online reference handbook might be more up-to-date and has helpful user-contributed comments.

It is your definitive reference point for all Drupal documentation.

Comment
